subject: Re: [junit] JUnit extra
msgSnippet: ... Try using the JUnit-addons Test Runner. It allows you to register a test listener that will help you know when to take a snapshot of the application log
messageBody:
Dennis N. Stetsenko wrote:

> Hello
>
>
>
> I'm trying to figure out the best way to extend/modify JUnit framework +
> Ant Task to fit my specific needs, like:
>
> 1) I'm capturing screenshot and making snapshot of the application
> log file on each failure/error.
>
> 2) I've extended TestCase class (ETestCase) to add extra
> information per each executed test case (unique requirement id string ->
> ETestCase.req_id)
>
> 3) In case of failure/error I add unique string id of a screenshot
> to the ETestCase (ETestCase.picture_id)
>
>
>
> So, I want to automate execution of tests such way that I would receive
> XML file at the end with all custom fields from ETestCase (in order to
> make html afterwards with links to screenshots/log files for every
> failed test case). Ideally that would be extension to both JUnit and
> Ant.

Try using the JUnit-addons Test Runner. It allows you to register a test
listener that will help you know when to take a snapshot of the
application log file.

For producing the XML file, register another listener that builds in
memory the object model you want to dump to XML, then use something like
the Jakarta Commons Digester to turn that object model into an XML document.

Good luck.
